content.question: A job candidate at a large job fair can be classified as unacceptable, provisional, or acceptable. Based on past experience, a high-quality candidate is expected to get 80 percent acceptable ratings, 15 percent provisional ratings, and 5 percent unacceptable ratings. A high-quality candidate was evaluated by 100 companies and received 60 acceptable, 25 provisional, and 15 unacceptable ratings. A chi-square goodness-of-fit-test was conducted to investigate whether the evaluation of the candidate is consistent with past experience. What is the value of the chi-square test statistic and number of degrees of freedom for the test?

choices.label: <math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 5, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 5, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 15, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 15, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 80, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="2 degrees of freedom" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mtext>df</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 5, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 5, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 15, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 15, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 80, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="3 degrees of freedom" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext>df</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 5, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 5, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 15, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 15, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 80, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="99 degrees of freedom" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>99</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>df</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 5 minus 15, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 15, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 25, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 25, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 80 minus 60, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="2 degrees of freedom" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>df</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 5 minus 15, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 15, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 25, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 25, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 80 minus 60, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="3 degrees of freedom" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext>df</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 5, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 5, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 15, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 15, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 80, close parenthesis, squared and denominator 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="2 degrees of freedom" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mtext>df</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.3: Carrying out a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
